eventDesc: Want to get all the 411 on our new Waco Outlet location in the Brazos Place Shopping Center? Sign up for our email list, and we'll keep you updated about sales and store events. [Join the HPB Mailing List today](http://pages.hpbdirect.com/page.aspx?QS=3935619f7de112ef397c9ccd30f4da1186c50609709b5052de96182c7b4da3e0)!

Join us at your Sugar Land HPB on the first Saturday of each month, from 1:30 to 4:00 p.m., for Meow Book Buddies & Cat Adoptions. The animal advocacy nonprofit [Fort Bend Pets Alive!](https://www.fortbendpetsalive.org) invites kiddos ages 4 - 13 to practice their reading skills by reading to a cat in a safe environment. Plus, a select group of lovable cats will be available for adoption at a discount.

Pack up your half-pint readers and come to your Coon Rapids HPB for Sunday Storytime & Crafts. Sit down and enjoy a good tale and a special craft activity with us from 2 to 3 p.m. on the first Sunday of the month. Participants will receive a FREE pre-selected children's book. All ages are welcome!

Now is your chance to tell us who you think will win an Oscar. Stop by your Chesterfield HPB now through Sunday, March 4, to fill out your Oscar ballot. Be one of the top three entries with the most correct answers and win an HPB Gift Card. Winners will be notified on March 5. See store for details.

eventTitle: Lunch & Book Signing with Steve Berry
eventDesc: Half Price Books is pleased to welcome *New York Times* bestselling author Steve Berry for discussion of his new book *The Bishop's Pawn*. Join us on Thursday, March 22 for lunch at Maggiano's NorthPark Center. Check in starts at 11:30 a.m. Steve's presentation will begin at noon, followed by a book signing. ADVANCED TICKETS REQUIRED, purchased via [Eventbrite](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/lunch-book-signing-with-bestselling-author-steve-berry-tickets-42093138711). Books will also be available for purchase at the event. [See Facebook Event](https://www.facebook.com/events/1837917319561359/).

Attention St. Louis-area high school students! We are currently taking poetry submissions in preparation for National Poetry Month in April. Your Chesterfield, U City and St. Charles HPBs will accept any style poem at 30 lines or less. The top three winners at each store will win a $100, $75 or $50 HPB Gift Card. Deadline for submissions is Sunday, March 18. Please see store for guidelines and entry forms. Select submissions will be included in a collection showcasing local teen poets.

Each year, young and old alike celebrate Read Across America Day on March 2 in conjunction with Dr. Seuss' birthday. Join us at your Flagship HPB in Dallas for a special storytime on Friday, March 2, from 4:30 to 6:30 p.m. Grab your net and hold onto your "Thing 1" and "Thing 2" for a special Seussian craft after.

We're getting *wild* for Read Across America Day! Join us at your Marion HPB for a special *Where the Wild Things Read* kids' party on Saturday, March 3, from 1 to 3 p.m. We'll have storytime at 1 and 2 p.m., craft stations to make paper boats and crowns, cookies and lemonade, plus, friendly animals to meet. All ages are invited and dress up is encouraged. Let the wild rumpus start!

We're celebrating Dr. Seuss' Birthday! Pack up your "Thing 1" and "Thing 2" and join us at your Olympia Half Price Books Outlet for a special Dr. Seuss Storytime on Saturday, March 3, from 2 to 4 p.m. We'll read our favorite Dr. Seuss stories and color some whimsical and wacky artistic creations!

Meet local author Robert Lovelle Rooks on Sunday, March 4, from 1 to 3 p.m. at your Flagship HPB in Dallas. Robert will sell and sign his novel *Filipina*, based on true Pinay stories. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

Meet local author Francia Noble on Sunday, March 4, from 1 to 3 p.m. at your Flagship HPB in Dallas. Francia will sell and sign her book *Doing Business God's Way: Devotions for the Entrepreneur*. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

Join us for a special Meow Book Buddies Storytime at your Sugar Land HPB on Saturday, March 3, from 2 to 2:30 p.m. We are celebrating Dr. Seussâ€™ birthday and reading *The Cat in the Hat* to real cats! "You find magic wherever you look. Sit back and relax. All you need is a book." - Dr. Seuss, *The Cat in the Hat*

Each year, young and old alike celebrate Read Across America Day on March 2 in conjunction with Dr. Seuss' birthday. Join us at your East Madison HPB for a special storytime on Friday, March 2, from 11 to 11:30 a.m. Participating young readers will receive a free preselected kid's book plus light snacks.

Pack up your half-pint readers and come to your East Madison HPB for Storytime Wednesday. Sit down and enjoy a good tale with us from 11 to 11:30 a.m. on March 7. Participating young readers will receive a free preselected kid's book plus light snacks.

Meet local author Sandra Anderson on Saturday, March 3, from 2 to 4 p.m. at your Everett HPB. Sandra will sell and sign her memoir *Troubled Mother, Troubled Son: Both Living, One Dying with Secrets*. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

Meet local author Patricia Varhola on Saturday, March 3, from 1 to 3 p.m. at your Monroeville HPB. Patricia will sell and sign her book *Hair Raising Stories: A Collection of True Short Stories*. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

Meet local author Keya Briscoe on Saturday, March 10, from 1 to 3 p.m. at your Sugar Land HPB. Keya will sell and sign her parenting book *Lessons for our Daughters*. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

Meet local author Jay Gibson on Sunday, March 11, from 1 to 3 p.m. at your Flagship HPB in Dallas. Jay will sell and sign his book *Men = Responsibility: What It All Means and Why Men, Young and Old, Should Always Embrace Being Responsible*. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

Meet local author Leonard Critcher on Sunday, March 11, from 1 to 3 p.m. at your Flagship HPB in Dallas. Leonard will sell and sign his book *Welcome to the Metroplex!*, a complete guide to DFW. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

Meet local author Sheryl Grace on Saturday, March 10, from 3 to 5 p.m. at your South Arlington HPB. Sheryl will sell and sign her novel *He Calls Her Blue*. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

We're celebrating Dr. Seuss' Birthday! Pack up your "Thing 1" and "Thing 2" and join us at your Rockford Half Price Books Outlet for a special Dr. Seuss Storytime on Sunday, March 4, from 2 to 3 p.m. We'll have snacks and coloring time, plus participating young readers will receive a free preselected kid's book.

Pack up your half-pint readers and bring them to your Bandera HPB in San Antonio for a silly and fun time! We're having a Mustache Storytime on Sunday, March 11, from 2 to 3 p.m. Sit down and enjoy a good tale with us plus snacks, games and prizes.

Looking for FREE Friday night family fun? Bring your family and friends for a stress-free evening of rock painting at your Mesa HPB on Friday, March 16, from 6 to 8 p.m. We will supply the rocks and supplies; you supply the talent. Painted rocks are a fun way to share a pretty image or a word of kindness. Give your rock to a friend or leave it in a special place for someone to find.

eventTitle: Collectible Conversations: The Charles K. Feldman/Jean Howard Collection
eventDesc: Calling all film buffs! HPB's Ben Jousan will host a presentation of a recently acquired collection: books signed by and inscribed to agent/producer Charles K. Feldman and his wife, actress/photographer Jean Howard. The collection includes rare first editions, movie memorabilia and other curiosities. Mark your calendars for Thursday, March 29, from 6 to 7 p.m. at your Flagship HPB in Dallas. [See Facebook Event](https://www.facebook.com/events/1795996114043555/).

We're celebrating the greatest mysteries of all time. Check out our favorites from the genre, gumshoe staff picks and much, much more! Stop by your local HPB store and discover both new and classic tales. We'll help you solve the mystery of what to read next.

Load up your wee leprechauns, kick up your heels and jiggety-jog into your Olympia HPB Outlet on Saturday, March 17, from 2 to 5 p.m. as we celebrate St. Patrick's Day! Listen to Irish stories and music, create charming crafts and enjoy a lovely snack. Don't forget to wear green! All ages invited.

Discover a new thriller writer! Meet former Navy SEAL and author Jack Carr on Tuesday, March 20, at 7 p.m. at your Flagship HPB in Dallas. Jack will discuss and sign his new political thriller *The Terminal List*. Books available for purchase as specially-priced new items while supplies last. Numbered passes will be available beginning March 20, at 9 a.m. One pass per customer, please. [See Facebook Event](https://www.facebook.com/events/454943918254728/).

Has your book club read *Before We Were Yours*? Come meet the author! *New York Times* bestselling author Lisa Wingate will be at your Flagship HPB in Dallas on Tuesday, March 27, at 7 p.m. Lisa will discuss and sign her bestselling novel *Before We Were Yours*. Books available for purchase as specially-priced new items while supplies last. Numbered passes will be available beginning March 27, at 9 a.m. One pass per customer, please. [See Facebook Event](https://www.facebook.com/events/156418435018844/).

We're celebrating the greatest mysteries of all time on Mystery Mania Day, Tuesday, March 20, at your Flagship HPB in Dallas. Our bibliomaniacs will be dressed as favorite mystery characters, and you are invited to play games for fabulous mystery prizes. Let us help you solve the mystery of what to read next.

Your Maplewood HPB is ready for spring! Join us on Thursday, March 22, from 5 to 7 p.m. when we celebrate the official start of spring with spring-themed crafts. There will be plenty of supplies to share plus assistance if needed. All ages are invited.

Join us and experience the fun of board games! We're hosting demo games at your Mesa HPB on Friday, March 23, from 6 to 8 p.m. We'll have a selection of games available to play for all ages and difficulty levels and will feature Hisashi Hayashi's Trains. Bring your friends and family and check out our great selection of Tabletop Games.

Let's get crafty! Your Monroeville HPB is hosting a paper bead workshop on Saturday, March 24, from 2 to 4 p.m. Participants will learn how to craft beads out of paper for use in the making of fashionable and crafty jewelry. The event is free, and all materials will be provided.

eventTitle: HPB at the Tucson Festival of Books
eventDesc: Look for HPB booth #411 at the [Tucson Festival of Books](http://tucsonfestivalofbooks.org) on Saturday and Sunday, March 10 and 11. We'll have fiction and young adult books for sale at the University of Arizona Campus in Tucson. See you there!

eventTitle: St. Patty's Putting on the Green
eventDesc: Make St. Patrick's Day your lucky day. Your Rockford Half Price Books Outlet invites you to come in for a day of fun on Saturday, March 17. All ages are invited to test your putting skills on our in-store miniature golf-style green. You could win up to 50% OFF your highest priced item!

Stock up on books, music, movies and games at your Olympia Half Price Books Outlet! Take an additional 50% OFF everything in store on Saturday, March 10. Offer good at Olympia HPB Outlet location only. Not valid on gift certificate purchases. All sales are final.

Meet author William H. Venema on Friday, March 16, from 4 to 8 p.m. at your Berkeley HPB. William will sell and sign his military thriller *Death in Panama*, loosely based on a court-martial case that he prosecuted in 1983 when he was assigned as an Army lawyer in Panama. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

Meet author William H. Venema on Saturday, March 17, from 12 to 2 p.m. at your Concord HPB. William will sell and sign his military thriller *Death in Panama*, loosely based on a court-martial case that he prosecuted in 1983 when he was assigned as an Army lawyer in Panama. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

Meet local author Therone Shellman on Sunday, March 18, from 1 to 3 p.m. at your Flagship HPB in Dallas. Therone will sell and sign his spiritual book *Third Eye Awakening*. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

Get cash for your books, music and movies! Our new Vernon Hills store opens for buying starting Thursday, March 15. Bring your used stuff to sell during our pre-Great Opening hours 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. every day. While you're in the store, be sure to ask for some money-saving coupons to save even more during our Great Opening Celebration Thursday, April 12 - Sunday, April 15!

eventTitle: Win a $100 Gift Card at our Vernon Hills Great Opening
eventDesc: Join us for our Great Opening Celebration Thursday, April 12 - Sunday, April 15 at 701 N. Milwaukee Ave. in the Rivertree Court Shopping Center, next to Old Navy. The first 100 people through the door at 9 a.m. Thursday through Sunday at our new Vernon Hills store get a FREE tote bag and $5 gift card!* One tote bag will contain a $100 gift card! Feeling lucky? Visit each day for a new chance to win. *Limit one tote bag per person, 16 years of age and up. Offer valid 4.12.18 - 4.15.18 at Vernon Hills location only. One random $100 gift card winner each day, Thursday - Sunday.

Bring your used stuff to sell during our pre-Great Opening hours 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day. While you're in the store, be sure to ask for some money-saving coupons to save even more during our Great Opening Celebration Thursday, April 5 - Sunday, April 8!

It's Mystery Madness at HPB! Join us at your Tukwila HPB on March 7, from 6 to 8 p.m., for a mysterious evening of fun and games! Play a mystery-themed board game with a chance to win exciting and mysterious prizes! Stop by and let us help you solve the mystery of what to play next.

Looking for FREE family fun? Bring your own chair and get comfy at the free Sunday Family Movie Matinee at your Flagship HPB in Dallas. Join us on select Sundays in March after Storytime from 4 - 6 p.m. for a family-friendly movie, complete with fresh popcorn. Mark your calendar for these Sunday Family Movie dates: March 11 & 25. Check in store to see what we are playing this month.

Looking for FREE family fun? Bring your own chair and get comfy at the free Sunday Family Movie Matinee at your Flagship HPB in Dallas. Join us on select Sundays in April after Storytime from 4 - 6 p.m. for a family-friendly movie, complete with fresh popcorn. Mark your calendar for these Sunday Family Movie dates: April 8 & 22. Check in store to see what we are playing this month.

Looking to expand your reading pleasure? Join our store's Book Club discussion of the dystopian novel *Station Eleven* by Emily St. John Mandel at your Everett HPB on Thursday, March 22, from 6 to 7 p.m.

Put on your deerstalker cap and get ready for "Mystery Trivia - Name That Detective" at your Maplewood HPB. Join us on Thursday, March 29, to test your mystery book knowledge. Guess the correct detective based on a mystery novel description for a chance to win a $25 HPB Gift Card.

Gather up the kiddos and hop on over to your Flagship HPB in Dallas on Saturday, March 31 from 11 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Kids 12 and under are invited to participate in our Easter Egg Scavenger Hunt. Be sure to bring your Easter basket and follow the clues to find eggs and surprises. No purchase necessary.

Meet local author Laura Bonano on Saturday, March 24, from 1 to 3 p.m. at your Fort Wayne HPB. Laura will sell and sign her humor book *Why is There a Toothbrush in the Bushes: And Other Little Life Mysteries*. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

Meet local author S.J. Ateca on Saturday, March 24, from 1 to 3 p.m. at your Rockford Half Price Books Outlet. S.J. will sell and sign his novel *Head Games*. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

Meet local author Amy Winfield on Sunday, March 25, from 1 to 3 p.m. at your Flagship HPB in Dallas. Amy will sell and sign copies of her children's book *Cautious Fred*. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

Meet local author English Minter on Sunday, March 25, from 1 to 3 p.m. at your Flagship HPB in Dallas. English will sell and sign copies of her children's book *Filly's Day on the Farm*. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

Meet local author K. V. Nguyen on Saturday, March 31, from 1 to 3 p.m. at your Watauga HPB. K.V. will sell and sign his book *Your Home is Sick! 11 Ways to Make Your Home Energy Efficient*. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

Meet local author Shane Lassetter on Saturday, March 31, from 12 to 3 p.m. at your Sugar Land HPB. Shane will sell and sign his young adult book *Outlast: Geeks Will Gather*. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

Meet author William H. Venema on Friday, March 23, from 5 to 8 p.m. at your Redmond HPB. William will sell and sign his military thriller *Death in Panama*, loosely based on a court-martial case that he prosecuted in 1983 when he was assigned as an Army lawyer in Panama. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

Meet local author Jerry Poscovsky on Saturday, March 24, from 12 to 3 p.m. at your Sugar Land HPB. Jerry will sell and sign his Children's book *Hippidi & Dippidi*. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

eventTitle: Austin Edible Book Festival at HPB
eventDesc: Mark your calendars and start cooking up ideas to enter the 16th Annual Austin Edible Book Festival. Your North Lamar HPB is the contest host for food entries on Sunday, April 1, from 6 to 8 p.m. All edible books must be "bookish" through the integration of text, literary inspiration or, quite simply, the form. Prizes awarded for Funniest, Most Appetizing, Least Appetizing, Best Construction and Best in Show. What better time than April Fool's Day to eat your words? The festival is a food drive for Central Texas Food Bank, too, so bring something non-perishable to donate. [See Facebook Event](https://www.facebook.com/ATXEBF/) for details.

Meet local author Misty Hayes on Saturday, March 24, from 1 to 3 p.m. at your Ridgmar/Westover Village HPB in Fort Worth. Misty will sell and sign copies of her fantasy book *The Outcasts: The Blood Dagger Volume 1*. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

Meet renowned motivational speaker Lizzie Velasquez on Tuesday, March 27, at 7 p.m. at your North Lamar HPB in Austin. Lizzie will discuss and sign her inspirational book *Dare to Be Kind: How Extraordinary Compassion Can Transform Our World*. Books available for purchase as specially-priced new items while supplies last. [See Facebook Event](https://www.facebook.com/events/156265648333041/).

Meet local author Robert Lovelle Rooks on Saturday, March 31, from 1 to 3 p.m. at your South Lamar HPB in Austin. Robert will sell and sign his novel *Filipina*, based on true Pinay stories. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

Meet local writer and poet Brittany Griffiths on Sunday, April 1, from 1 to 3 p.m. at your Flagship HPB in Dallas. Brittany will sell and sign copies of her poetry collection. Books will be sold independently by the author while supplies last.

The University of Wisconsin Russian Folk Orchestra is celebrating their 20th anniversary! Meet founder and music director Victor Gorodinsky at your West Madison HPB on Sunday, March 25, from 2 to 4 p.m. Victor and orchestra members will discuss and sell their special 20th anniversary CD/DVD release. CD/DVDs will be sold independently while supplies last.

Half Price Books is proud to be the official bookseller of the [2018 Dallas Book Festival](http://dallasbookfestival.org/index.php) happening on Saturday, April 7, from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. at the J. Erik Jonsson Central Library in downtown Dallas. The Dallas Book Festival is a community-based literary event promoting reading, literacy and writing and featuring local, regional and national authors. Join us for this fun event!
